snippet: Most Catholics say Pope Francis represents a change for the church, but his popularity has not inspired more Americans to attend Mass or identify as Catholic, a poll found.
abstract: Pew Research Center poll finds that broad majority of American Catholics say Pope Francis represents a major change in the direction of the church, and a change for the better; popularity has not inspired more Americans to attend Mass, go to confession or identify as Catholic.
lead_paragraph: Most Catholics say Pope Francis represents a change for the church, but his popularity has not inspired more Americans to attend Mass or identify as Catholic, a poll found.

headline.main: Francis Has Changed American Catholics’ Attitudes, but Not Their Behavior, a Poll Finds
headline.print_headline: Francis Has Changed Catholics’ Attitudes, but Not Their Behavior, a Poll Finds
